processed_nodes.label: To-do list
processed_nodes.problem_description: The node likely represents a specific document owned by Jukka, but its label is generic. This creates an inconsistent naming problem. Other fields look reasonable and not misclassified.
processed_nodes.resolution_notes:
Recommended repairs:
1) Relabel to a specific, disambiguated title using Title Case and ASCII punctuation, e.g., "Jukka's To-Do List" (preferred) or "Jukka - To-Do List". If multiple lists exist, add a disambiguator such as platform or year, e.g., "Jukka's To-Do List (Notion)".
2) Add aliases to preserve findability and accommodate variants: ["To-do list" (previous label), "Todo list", "Task list", "Jukka todo list", "Jukka task list"].
3) Tweak the description for clarity and objectivity and to use ASCII apostrophes: "Jukka's personal task tracker used to organize and prioritize work and personal tasks; serves as his central reference for planning." Avoid speculative details about platform unless known.
4) Keep Type: Entity and Category: document as-is.
5) Ensure hyphenation/casing consistency for 'To-Do' across label and aliases per project style guide.
